definition: to make a report (to a superior)/to give/to endow/to receive/petition
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: Report a king up, this vegetarian food that is to resist the vegetables that the food architecture stirs, all such.
sentences.chinese: 稟告王上，這是御膳房撥來的菜，都是這樣的素食。

sentences.english: Madam, I have seen 9527 staying with these thieves.
sentences.chinese: 稟告夫人，我看到9527跟他們在一起。

sentences.english: They returned to the king to tell him about their betrothed.
sentences.chinese: 三個王子回來向國王稟告了自己找到的未婚妻的情況。

sentences.english: Paolumen told him all what he encountered on the road.
sentences.chinese: 於是婆羅門向佛稟告他在路上看到的事。

sentences.english: The hostler ran to report it to the general immediately.
sentences.chinese: 馬伕急忙跑去把這事稟告將軍。

sentences.english: These matter I secretly such as actually reported a dad emperor, the dad emperor is very joyed.
sentences.chinese: 這些事我都私下裏如實稟告了父皇，父皇很是欣慰。

sentences.english: Aladdin's mother told the sultan about her son's wish.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉丁的媽媽把她兒子的願望向蘇丹王稟告。

definition: to kowtow (traditional greeting, esp. to a superior, involving kneeling and pressing one's forehead to the ground)/also written 磕頭|磕头[ke1 tou2]
to pay homage at a mausoleum
to obey an order/to take orders/to accept a state of affairs
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
to celebrate a birthday (of an elderly person)
